website_summaries.verdict: While people had some good things to say about the New Balance Summit QOM, like the vibrant design and the traction-ready outsole, most weren’t happy about the sizing scheme and the width of the forefoot. The irritating interior lining and the bulky frame were also negative points that were highlighted.
pros: Consumers generally welcomed the color schemes of the New Balance Summit QOM, stating that the hues were visually pleasing
The outsole was appreciated for being durable despite the abrasive nature of the surfaces
A few users admired the overall design of the Summit QOM
The shoe offers a great grip on varied surfaces, noted in some user comments
Several users noted the comfortable and smooth in-shoe feel of the New Balance Summit QOM
cons: Some of those who have tried the New Balance Summit QOM claimed that the sizing schemes were smaller than the usual
According to some consumers, the toe box was narrow, bunching the toes together uncomfortably
A few people didn’t like the bulky frame of this running shoe

customer_reviews.title: No flex
customer_reviews.text: Returned these. They are very heavy and have absolutely no flex. Super uncomfortable, I ordered up a half size and they were still too small.
customer_reviews.author: KVW

customer_reviews.title: Love NB, but won’t buy these again
customer_reviews.text: Need to wear thick socks, there is a ridge at the base of toes on top that hurts if wearing thin socks. I had seen this complaint in other reviews before I bought these. I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Brook Sternberg

customer_reviews.title: Run narrow
customer_reviews.text: These shoes run narrow. Toe box not as wide as others.
customer_reviews.author: Dannianni

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat small and narrow for a wide size
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat small and narrow for a wide size. Also, the arch support is poor. So they were returned but ordered 1/2 size up and they work well with my favorite inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Justnes

customer_reviews.title: Not a men's shoe
customer_reviews.text: Beware: the gray version of this shoe is WOMEN'S. They are there Summit: QOM - which stands for Queen of the Mountain. If you see a pink-ish color on the tongue and the side, they're the women's version. Men's version has gray writing in those spots. No clue why this is listed as a men's shoe. Great job, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Pfiffner

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy wide unless you are proven wide
customer_reviews.text: Bought wide because of the reviews and was dissapointed. NO need to buy Wide unless you are a proven wide foot person.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia Galeano

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for hiling!
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these shoes. Ijust hiked 5 miles and they are very comfortable and su pportive. A week later part of the collar of the shoe where I put my foot in is pulling away on both shoes! I'm very disappointed! I hope New Ballance will get in touch with me to make this right. I can send pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Best

customer_reviews.title: Hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for hiking. I live in the desert so I expected something a little more lightweight. They are perfect for hiking though. They are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for Obstacle course races....I wear an 11 in womens and purchased a 12 for the purpose of racing and they fit perfectly! Super comfortable and lots of support
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First time owning a New Balance shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this shoe. I love that it's not tight around my toes and they are extremely comfortable. This is my first pair of New Balance and I'm extremely happy with the overall fit, looks and comfort of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Listed incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: These are women's shoes not mens. Thanks Amazon for the inconvenience
customer_reviews.author: zerad e.

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Have only wore these 1 time, thought they were suppose to be wide, but I can barely get my foot in them, and when I do it feels like my foot is smashed in them. Not happy with this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: sheri richardson

customer_reviews.title: Fit great
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear. No blisters, good toe protection and thick enough soles.
customer_reviews.author: Luna4

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I loved these shoes! So comfortable! Hard but perfect for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: SharHen

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking Pikes Peak 1st day
customer_reviews.text: Great on Pikes Peak the first day I wore them. Fit like a glove, no blisters after 14 miles on the trail. Great traction, love the protective tie cap too
customer_reviews.author: bridget m walsh

customer_reviews.title: Hard shoe
customer_reviews.text: To hard and stiff. Not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, great on trails
customer_reviews.text: I like to get off the road in my neighborhood and go on the nature trail down the block. Some parts of it are paved but not all. These shoes are great for hiking in an unpaved area. They are also great on sand dunes. We have a lot of dunes areas here too and I love walking on them. I would generally prefer barefoot, but have learned my lesson, not the first or second or third time. These would also be good for running but, again injured on hiking paths. Better to walk fast. :D
customer_reviews.author: Trouble

product_meta.title: New Balance Women's Summit KOM Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: These Summit KOM shoes from New Balance delivers a fine balance of underfoot comfort, aggressive traction and security to ensure it can perform on any terrain. Rockstop forefoot plate provides protection against sharp rocks and rough terrain debris.
